alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:46AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern West Baton Rouge, central Iberville and south central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 815 AM CDT... At 745 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grosse Tete to 6 miles east of Catahoula. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Addis, Brusly, Westminster, Inniswold, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Gardere and Old Jefferson. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 154 and 165. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southeastern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
